Good Question! 
 
I have always wondered about that. Having quite figured it out on the assertEquals, but on the assertTrue I us something like this this:
 
assertTrue(!image.isChild());
 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Robert DiFalco <rdifalco@...> wrote:
Yeah, it is a little odd. We have an AbstractTestCase and we just added
the two version of #assertNotEquals there. We also added an
#assertEqualsSameHash which makes sure that if two objects are equal,
that their hashes are also equal.

-----Original Message-----
From: Leeuw van der, Tim [mailto:tim.leeuwvander@...] 
Sent: Tuesday, June 24, 2003 7:22 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Why no assertNotEquals()?


Hi,

I don't know if this is a FAQ; didn't find it in the FAQ questions. But
why is there no assertNotEquals? In writing testcases for custom
equals() functions I often need to test that 2 different instances
return false for the equals() operator, so I occasionally have a need
for such a method.

Regards,

--Tim
